snippet: The Syrian regime would collapse without Hezbollah’s backing. Negotiating with Hezbollah’s patron, Iran, could end the group’s support for Assad.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Jonathan Stevenson argues Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad's brutal regime  would collapse without backing of Lebanese militant group Hezbollah; maintains if Pres Obama negotiates with Hezbollah's patron, Iran, it could end group's support for Assad.
lead_paragraph: The Syrian regime would collapse without Hezbollah’s backing. Negotiating with Hezbollah’s patron, Iran, could end the group’s support for Assad.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
